name: L'Industrie Pizzeria
hours: {'Saturday': '12 to 10\u202fPM', 'Sunday': '12 to 10\u202fPM', 'Monday': '12 to 10\u202fPM', 'Tuesday': '12 to 10\u202fPM', 'Wednesday': '12 to 10\u202fPM', 'Thursday': '12 to 10\u202fPM'}
reviews: ['I recently tried Industry Pizza in Brooklyn, and unfortunately, I wasn’t too impressed. I had heard a lot of good things about the place, so maybe I just happened to catch them on a bad day. For starters, the bathrooms were out of order, …', 'I was really impressed by the large number of people at the location and the long line for ordering. The atmosphere both inside and outside the store was fantastic! The staff were exceptionally nice, which made for a pleasant experience. …', 'The best pizza I’ve tried in New York and Brooklyn! Be aware that there can be long lines at certain times of the day, especially during peak meal hours. It’s almost impossible to eat inside, but there’s a quirky bus outside where you can enjoy your slices. The pizza is incredibly delicious and flavorful—definitely worth it!', 'Best slice in NYC on a recent trip to the city. Crust and dough was fantastic, a nice mix of NY and Napolitan pizza. Toppings were fresh, cooked to perfection. Friendly staff cool environment in the shop. Standing room only for dine in.', 'Came here at 12pm when they opened and there’s already a line but it did move quickly. Honestly, it’s the best pizza I’ve had in NY, I’ve tried slices from all the popular places like Mama Too’s, Joe’s and Bleeker st and this is the best. Pizza is cooked perfectly and not burnt underneath. A little pricey but well worth it.']

name: Double Chicken Please
reviews: ['I highly recommend Double Chicken Please, a standout bar that offers a unique and flavorful experience. One of the highlights for me was the salty egg chicken sandwich—it’s simply amazing! The flavors are rich and well-balanced, making it a …', 'Double Chicken Please NYC absolutely blew me away in the best possible way. I initially checked out the menu for their creative—and honestly, slightly bizarre-sounding—cocktails, and ended up going straight to “The Coop.” The entire …', 'Overall the food, ambiance, and service was really great! My friend and I did not do any research before coming here though and it was a confusing experience. We came on a weekday evening. When we got there we just put our name down and it …', 'Added my party of 2 to the waitlist at The Coop, when we went on the Valentine’s Day evening. Our table was ready 2 hours later. We really enjoyed the food, the mochi donut sandwich was incredible! I really enjoyed the salted egg yolk …', 'We loved it!\n\nDrinks were very delicious and extra innovative! We tried Japanese Cold Noodles, …']

name: Thai Diner
reviews: ['We visited Thai Diner on Mott Street and had to wait about an hour for a table, which was a bit disappointing. The Thai iced tea was refreshing and tasty, but the Tom Yum soup was far too sour and didn’t have the right balance of flavors. …', 'I recently made my second visit to Thai Diner, a restaurant situated on the edge of Little Italy, a somewhat unexpected location for a Thai establishment. Despite its location, the diner was busy with both patrons and staff. …', 'Man oh man where do I even start.. First of all if you plan to eat here on a weekend or even during business hours be prepared to wait! We didn’t have any reservations so we ended up having to wait around 1-1.5 hours for a table …', 'After hearing great things upon our arrival to NYC, we arrived right at opening on a Friday to guarantee ourselves a seat. The coolest interior, friendly staff and fantastic food. We shared the crispy rice eggs and French toast. I think next time I would try the pancakes instead, but still delicious.', 'Tried brunch with my girls here today and it was incredible. We shared the egg sandwich, fried eggs, and coconut pancakes. They were each unique and delicious, new take on brunch food I’ve never had before with thai basil and spices. Will definitely be back! Recommend going on a weekday to avoid the line']

name: Soothr
hours: {'Saturday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 11\u202fPM', 'Sunday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 10\u202fPM', 'Monday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 10\u202fPM', 'Tuesday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 10\u202fPM', 'Wednesday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 10\u202fPM', 'Thursday': '12 to 3:30\u202fPM, 5 to 10\u202fPM'}
reviews: ['The hype is real. This intimate place reminds me of my first time in Thailand. Yes because the food is delicious and flavorful, but mostly because of the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. My waitress was amazing but it was my …', 'Our server was Nina and she was so friendly! She did a great job checking in on us and giving us recommendations. …', 'Firstly, the atmosphere was authentic and really brings the Thai culture. The food was nicely done but there was nothing WOW. I do love how they place lychee in the duck curry it really balances the flavour of sweet and savoury. The …', 'Easy to make reservations, friendly staffs. I highly recommend to ask for paper menu instead of QR code menu (so confusing). We were 5 people, order 2 appetizers and 5 entrees with 1 side dish. Everything was so good. I highly recommend the Tom Yum hot pot (decent size for sharing), and Chicken with Crispy noodles, also the Koong Curry!!', 'We had a wonderful dining experience! The food was delicious with generous portions, and our server, Nina, was outstanding. …']
